bibl.title: Lars Brown v. Unknown. Shipping Fees.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Recieved of J P Ludlow Tax valued at Five Dollars Addressed James Seavey H Tawuaind W.T.
div1.p: Which we undertake to forward by usual conveyance, to the nearest point to destination reached by this Company, subject to the following conitions, namely: This Company is not to be liable for any loss or damage expect as forwarders only, nor for any loss or damage by fire by the dangers of navigation, stage or railway transportation (unless specially insured by this Company and so specified herein); nor by the act of God, nor of the enemies of the Government, the restraints of Government, mobs, riots, insurections, pirates, or from or by reason of any of the hazards or dangers incideit to a state of war. Nor shall this Company be liable for any default or negligence of any person, corporation or association, to whom the above described property shall or may be delivered by this companhy, in the performance of any act or duty in respect thereto, at any place or point off the established routes or lines of this company, and any such person, corporation or association is not to be regarded deemed or taken to be the agent of this Company for any such purpose, but on the contrary, such person, corportation, or association shall be deemed and taken to be the agent of the person, corporation or association from whom this Company recieved the property above described; nor shall this Company be liable on any shipment for an amount excediddng FIFTY DOLLARS, unless hte true vaule thereof is herein states; nor for any amount upon any property or thing unless properly packed and secured for transportation; nor upon any fragile fabrics, unless so marked upon the package containing the same; nor upon articles consisting of or contained in glass. And it is also understood that the stipulations contained herein shall extend to and inure to the benefit of each and every contrary or person to whom through this Company the above described property may be intrusted or delievered for transportation. The party accepting this receipt hereby agrees to the foregoing conditions.
div1.ab: Read The Conditions Of This Receipt
